revised_title: Discovery of a Reducing Substance in Blood and its Relation to Sugar Levels
tldr: The author discusses the existence of a reducing substance in the blood, apart from sugar, which is stable and resistant to putrefaction. This substance amounts to.200 to.300 per 1,000 and should be deducted from the given sugar levels in the blood. The author also mentions astronomical, magnetic, and meteorological observations made in the years 1859, 1875, and 1876 under the direction of Sir George B. Airy.
